item.title: Hour of The Village
item.description: Non-time in the Southwest - The time of the village is 4:30 in the afternoon. This is the time that I’m really feeling the village. Feeling what a village feels like. It’s that time of the day where there is a pause between the hard work done out on the land during the meat of the day and the time that we all gather for dinner. There is the generally satisfied air of a day well spent that permeates the energy of the tribe.
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: The Place That Is Not a Place
item.description: A Blindfolded Day, Part 2 - I’m a few hours into a 24-hour blindfold challenge. I’m experiencing very clear vision behind my blindfold. I’m finding it disturbingly close to what I know of the “actual reality” but not quite the same. It’s an uncanny valley that I’m not crossing.
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: Only in Silence the Word
item.description: A Blindfolded Day, Part 1 - Still in my sleeping bag I place the folded bandana over my eyes and tie it behind my head. The pre-dawn greyness is replaced with inky blackness. I won’t be removing this bandana, I hope, until I hear the wake up song tomorrow morning. Between now and then lies 300 miles and 24 hours of unseen and unforeseen experiences.
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: The Scrappy Ninja
item.description: A Game of Capture the Flag - We’re about 30 minutes into a game of capture the flag. I’m currently “guarding” our flag. My clothing is shades of mottled green and my face is streaked with mud and soot. My shirt has homemade fringe running down the arms. Supposedly I’m camouflaged, but I feel as visible as a hot pink air balloon in crisp blue sky. And I feel immobilized because of it.
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: Thank You For This Moment
item.description: Thanksgiving Address Reflection - Thank you for reading this. I want to recognize the importance of that. The "if a tree falls in the woods and there's no one there to hear it, is there a sound?" question applies equally to written words. If there is no one reading them, are bits and bytes really words? How much of existence is in quantum superposition, decohered into concreteness only when *you* see it? Thank you for decohering this writing into concrete existence.
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: The Babbling Brook
item.description: Sense Meditation Reflection - What has occured to me, and this is fascinating, is that I previously didn't actually know what the stream sounded like. Since I didn't know what it sounded like there was no way I could hear it before I saw it. I mean, really, I knew what a stream sounds like. I've heard lots of streams in my day. But either I didn't know what *this* stream sounded like. Or I didn't know what pieces of the sound of a stream sounded like. And when you are further away and there are other noises all you might hear is a piece of a stream sound. Now I know a bit more what the components of stream sound are, so I might hear just one babble and realize, "oh, a babbling brook."
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: Dirt Medicine
item.description: Sit Spot Reflection - I’ve known for some time that my energy is recharged the most by being immersed in nature. This is the first time I’ve successfully had a practice where the intention is just that. And that says a lot.
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: Rocketships are Rad
item.description: An Introduction... - My name is Jeremiah. I'm a current student of the Anake program class of 2015. I’d like to introduce myself and tell you the story about how I ended up here. However, when I tell that story it no longer makes sense because here is not where I thought it was. Strangely, it's where I wanted it to be, without knowing. I'm really not sure how I ended up here, but with great fortune it's exactly where I need to be. Clear as the fresh spring waters of the Cascades? No doubt.
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: Poop, Fire, and Land
item.description: Field Course at Boulder Outdoor Survival School (BOSS)
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah

item.title: Glimpse
item.description: A Visit to Teaching Drum Wilderness School
item.dc:creator: Jeremiah
